structured_data.name: Global maps of cropland extent and change show accelerated cropland expansion in the twenty-first century
structured_data.description: This study presents an analysis of global cropland area change for the first two decades of the twenty-first century derived from satellite data time-series. It estimates that in 2019, the cropland area was 1,244 Mha and increased by 9% from 2003 to 2019, primarily due to agricultural expansion in Africa and South America. The expansion accelerated, with half of the new cropland replacing natural vegetation and tree cover. The presented global, high-resolution, cropland map time-series supports monitoring of natural land appropriation.

structured_data.name: GPWv411: Population Count (Gridded Population of the World Version 4.11)
structured_data.method_of_access: Earth Engine Snippet (API access), downloadable via NASA SEDAC
structured_data.data_format: GeoTIFF (implied by pixel size and gridded data)
structured_data.description: This dataset contains estimates of the number of persons per 30 arc-second grid cell consistent with national censuses and population registers. It models the distribution of global human population for the years 2000, 2005, 2010, 2015, and 2020 on 30 arc-second (approximately 1 km) grid cells. Population is distributed to cells using proportional allocation of population from census and administrative units. The dataset is provided by NASA SEDAC at the Center for International Earth Science Information Network (CIESIN).

structured_data.name: GHS-DEGURBA Toolkit (v2.11)
structured_data.method_of_access: Downloadable executable (.exe) and zip files for training material and documentation
structured_data.data_format: GeoTIFF (implied for population grids), PDF, TXT, ZIP
structured_data.description: The GHS-DEGURBA Toolkit is a suite of tools developed by the EC JRC to implement the Degree of Urbanisation. It includes tools for producing geospatial population grids (GHS-POP2G), warping population grids (GHS-POPWARP), classifying settlements (GHS-DUG), and classifying local units (GHS-DU-TUC). The tools are openly documented and freely available, aiming to improve reproducibility and facilitate information production for large and complex spatial data analytics scenarios.

structured_data.name: Sentinel-2 10-Meter Land Use/Land Cover
structured_data.subsector: Emissions from land within the city boundary
structured_data.description: A 10-meter annual map of Earth's land surface from 2017-2024, provided by Esri Land Cover. This high-resolution, open, accurate, comparable, and timely land use map is critical for decision-makers in various industry sectors and developing nations, improving understanding of topics like food security, land use planning, surface water, and resource management. Existing artificial intelligence (AI) land classification models were enhanced by bringing together a massive training dataset of billions of human-labeled image pixels.

structured_data.name: A spatially-explicit harmonized global dataset of critical infrastructure
structured_data.description: A first-of-its-kind globally harmonized spatial dataset for the representation of Critical Infrastructure (CI). It collects and harmonizes detailed geospatial data of the world’s main CI systems into a single geospatial database and develops the Critical Infrastructure Spatial Index (CISI) to express the global spatial intensity of CI. The CISI aggregates high-resolution geospatial OpenStreetMap (OSM) data of 39 CI types categorized under seven overarching CI systems. The dataset can be applied to explore the current landscape of CI, identify CI hotspots, and as exposure input for large-scale risk assessments.

structured_data.name: Integrated Geospatial Infrastructure
structured_data.method_of_access: Web interface query, implied data sharing and collaboration through interconnected networks
structured_data.description: The Integrated Geospatial Infrastructure, provided by Esri, focuses on connecting organizations across borders, jurisdictions, and sectors to address shared challenges efficiently and effectively. It emphasizes the evolution of traditional Spatial Data Infrastructure (SDI) to federated Web GIS, enabling collaboration for sustainable development, disaster management, and tackling biodiversity and climate change through shared data. It highlights pillars such as collaborative governance, data and technology, engagement, and capacity building.

structured_data.name: Global Roads Open Access Data Set, Version 1 (gROADSv1)
structured_data.description: The Global Roads Open Access Data Set, Version 1 (gROADSv1) combines the best available roads data by country into a global roads coverage, using the UN Spatial Data Infrastructure Transport (UNSDI-T) version 2 as a common data model. All country road networks have been joined topologically at the borders, and many countries have been edited for internal topology. The data was developed by the Center for International Earth Science Information Network - CIESIN - Columbia University, and Information Technology Outreach Services - ITOS - University of Georgia. The date range for road network representations ranges from the 1980s to 2010 depending on the country. The dataset is complete and updated as needed.

structured_data.sector: Agriculture, Forestry, and Other Land Use (AFOLU)
structured_data.description: This study presents a global scale dynamic land-use change model for long-term projections, integrating economic theory and observed behavior of land use change. It shows that the model can reproduce 20th century agricultural land use patterns.

structured_data.name: GHSL Data Package

It is produced by the European Commission, Directorate General Joint Research Centre, Global Human Settlement Layer project, supporting the GEO Human Planet Initiative (HPI).

structured_data.name: Global 1 km × 1 km gridded revised real gross domestic product and electricity consumption during 1992–2019 based on calibrated nighttime light data
structured_data.subsector: Commercial and Institutional Buildings and Facilities
structured_data.description: This study employed a series of methods, such as a particle swarm optimization-back propagation (PSO-BP) algorithm, to unify the scales of DMSP-OLS and NPP-VIIRS images and obtain continuous 1 km × 1 km gridded nighttime light data during 1992–2019. Subsequently, from a revised real growth perspective, a top-down method was employed to calculate global 1 km × 1 km gridded revised real GDP and electricity consumption during 1992–2019 based on calibrated nighttime light data.

structured_data.name: LandScan Global
structured_data.description: LandScan Global provides globally consistent and high-resolution data on where populations are on the planet, incorporating working populations, shopping populations, and students in schools, offering greater clarity than residential locations reported in official censuses. It has been used to estimate populations at risk and to plan, aid, and direct disaster recovery efforts. Provided by Oak Ridge National Laboratory (ORNL).

structured_data.name: WorldCover
structured_data.subsector: Emissions from land within the city boundary
structured_data.description: WorldCover provides global land cover products for 2020 and 2021 at 10m resolution, developed and validated in near-real time based on Sentinel-1 and Sentinel-2 data. It is developed by a consortium of European service providers and research organizations.

structured_data.name: WorldPop Program
structured_data.method_of_access: Downloadable files via WorldPop website and WOPR
structured_data.description: The WorldPop Program, provided by University Of Southampton (UK), University Of Louisville (USA), Universite Libre De Bruxelles (Belgium) And Flowminder Foundation, offers high resolution, open and contemporary data on human population distributions, including estimates of numbers of people residing in each 100 x 100 m grid cell and their age/sex structures. It produces high resolution maps of population counts and densities from 2000-2020, along with accompanying metadata and peer-reviewed academic papers on methods. The WorldPop Global data collection includes population surfaces for total populations (both adjusted to match UN national estimates, and left unadjusted) as well as breakdowns by age and sex classes.
